channel.title: @Greweb - Articles
channel.description: embrace standard web technologies for web, games and mobile apps

item.title: gl-react v3
item.description: gl-react has been reimplemented from scratch, feedback from previous mistake and overview of new features.

item.title: Relay, scrolling connections
item.description: implement a component handling the scroll of a list to pull more data of a Graphql Connection with Relay

item.title: ðŸŽ‰ There are some OpenGL in the Project September fashion app!
Universal GL Effects for Web and Native
Introducing gl-react
item.description: This presentation is an introduction to WebGL in React and functional programming concept and showcases made with gl-react and gl-react-native

item.title: Making performant React applications
item.description: I would like to express here my opinion and feedback on using React and performance optimization you can do.

item.title: [FR] webglparis talk: GLSL.io initiative and WebGL Transitions
item.description: A talk I did at webglparis to present GLSL.io and GLSL Transitions initiative.

item.title: Cellular Automata in IBEX
item.description: IBEX is my game made for js13kgames. This article explains how the game has been implemented with GLSL and cellular automata.

item.title: IBEX, my js13k game
item.description: IBEX is a game made in 13k of JavaScript code made for the js13kgames one-month contest.

item.title: 48 hours to prototype an Ant Sim Game
item.description: I gamejam-ed last weekend to the Ludum Dare 29 theming "Beneath the Surface" to develop "Anthill", a minimalist anthill simulation game.

item.title: Panzer Dragoon 1k
item.description: Panzer Dragoon 1k is a 2D remake of Panzer Dragoon in 1k of JavaScript I made for JS1K 2014

item.title: Promisify your games
item.description: a game showcase using Q Promise as first-class citizen and driven with CSS3 Animations via Zanimo.

item.title: Functional Rendering
item.description: This talk explains how to think the rendering in a more functional way. Let's see how we can just do things with a function of (Vec2 => Color).

item.title: Slides: Web Audio API, Overview
item.description: A presentation overview of the Web Audio API

item.title: Making a rhythm game with bleeding-edge web
item.description: While continuing to experiment with Web Audio API and GLSL, I've made a game called Timelapse for js13kgames (an HTML5 game competition where entries must be less than 13 kb zipped).

item.title: Beez, WebRTC + Audio API
item.description: Here is Beez, a web real-time audio experiment using smartphones as synthesizer effect controllers. This is our second Web Audio API experiment made in one Hackday at Zenexity.

item.title: Frequency Modulation (FM) with Web Audio API
ZOUND live v1 in development
item.description: Here is a preview video of the Work In Progress development of ZOUND live, the collaborative modular audio tracker built with bleeding edge web technologies: Web Audio API, Web MIDI API, WebSocket & Playframework.

item.title: ZOUND live project initiated
item.description: Last week, I initiated ZOUND live following my previous "ZOUND" experiment but being much more ambitious this time: using both the Audio API, the new MIDI API and electronic music software experience, we start our own web collaborative audio modular tracker.

item.title: Qep3.: QanimationFrame
item.description: This third article on Q is a little parenthesis to the Qep articles series, featuring the requestAnimationFrame Javascript function and its general usage, and QanimationFrame, its Promisified version used as a "wait for DOM to be ready" API.

item.title: Qep2.: Deferred objects, Qimage
item.description: This second article on Q will introduce you how to easily turn a callback API into a promise API using Deferred objects. It will also present the new W3C specification of Promise and finish with the implementation of Qimage, a simple Image Promise wrapper.

item.title: Qep1.: Q, a Promise library
item.description: This article is the first of a series of small articles on the Q Javascript library and its eco-system. It is a brief introduction to Q Promises.

item.title: Playframework simple deployment scripts
item.description: Playframework simple deployment scripts

item.title: glsl.js, a Javascript + GLSL library = DRY & efficient
item.description: WebGL is super powerful and efficient. This library abuses this power for efficient 2D.

item.title: PlayCLI: Play Iteratees + UNIX pipe
item.description: PlayCLI is a new Scala library to work with UNIX commands and Play-Iteratees (a scala implementation of Iteratees facilitating the handling of data streams reactively)

item.title: Be careful with JS numbers!
item.description: Javascript doesnâ€™t have integer type but lets you think it has. In Javascript, all numbers are floating numbers and are prone to floating point approximation.

item.title: Play Framework – Enumerator.outputStream
item.description: A few weeks ago, weâ€™ve introduced a new feature in Play Framework: the Enumerator.outputStream method, allowing you to work with Java API requiring an OutputStream to generate content, for instance the java.util.zip API.

item.title: Zound, a PlayFramework 2 audio streaming experiment using Iteratees
item.description: Zound uses an audio generator (JSyn, an audio synthesizer), encode the output and stream it all using Play Iteratees to pipe everything in real-time.

item.title: How I learned Backbone.js, Three.js & GLSL in one week
item.description: I learned to use Backbone.js and Three.js (a famous library on top of WebGL) to make a FPS in only one week.

item.title: Minimize your Javascript files with cURL
item.description: use Google Closure Compiler web service to minimize a Javascript file with only cURL.

item.title: Illuminated.js – 2D lights and shadows rendering engine for HTML5 applications
item.description: Illuminated.js is designed to add some awesome effects to your existing applications. Adding a cool atmosphere for your applications and games can make the difference!

item.title: HTML5 Canvas as a color converter
item.description: We can implement an anythingToRGBA converter in 10 lines of Javascript!

item.title: Work in <progress />
item.description: A progress tag will be displayed on recent browsers with a OS-native progress bar representing a loading.

item.title: Blender as a 2D game level editor – Proof Of Concept
item.description: Here is how you can design and export your 2D game map with Blender (both the logic and the graphics).

item.title: Play Painter – how i’ve improved the 30 minutes prototyped version
item.description: One week ago, Iâ€™ve released a web experiment featuring a collaborative Paint-like application made with Play Framework 2 and relying on WebSocket and HTML5 Canvas. Here is how I've improved it.

item.title: 30 minutes to make a multi user real time paint with Play 2 framework, Canvas and WebSocket.
item.description: [VIDEO] I will show you how to implement a multi user paint using latest web technologies like Play framework (version 2), HTML5 Canvas and WebSocket.

item.title: Chart libraries headaches – finding the best grid step
item.description: If you have ever made a chart library in your life, youâ€™ve probably asked yourself how to find the best scale for the grid in order to have nice values to display in the axis.

item.title: Bezier Curve based easing functions – from concept to implementation
item.description: Many animation libraries are today using easing functions â€“ functions of time returning a progression percentage value. We will see how we can generalize them with bezier curves.

item.title: CSS-selector-based templating system for scalable JavaScript applications
item.description: In this article, we will focus on the power of CSS as a descriptive language, current template system approach and their problems with modularity and extensibility, and try to mix both features from the concept to a concrete implementation.

item.title: How to deploy your play applications on ArchLinux with daemons
item.description: This video shows how to run different instances of Play framework server in the most Linux friendly way: using daemons. Example with ArchLinux, using yaourt, the playframework AUR package and nginx.

item.title: Improve your web navigation experience – Flexible Nav jQuery library
item.description: Flexible Nav is a small jQuery library which add a smart navigation bar on the right of the page. It improves a web page navigation and helps to visualize different sections of a document, an article,.. any web page.

item.title: Same Game Gravity: 6 platforms, 1 codebase
item.description: The Same Game is available for 6 different platforms. And I can pump out new builds for them all in around 15 minutes. Hereâ€™s howâ€¦

item.title: Same Game Gravity for iPad, iPhone, Android, Facebook, Chrome, and Web!
item.description: Same Game Gravity is today available on iPad, iPhone, Android, Web, Facebook Apps and Chrome Web Store.

item.title: Automating Web App development for multiple platforms
item.description: In this article, we will explain why weâ€™d choose web technologies to make applications and introduce WebAppBuilder, a tool to easily build different instances of an application. Weâ€™ll examine the Same Game Gravity as an example.

item.title: Releasing Same Game Gravity (Android)
item.description: Following on from the success of my Same game made in HTML5 Canvas, Iâ€™ve decided to extend it to a (web) mobile game.
